title: 2-Lane Setup Sequence (TA-17)
description: 15-step sequential setup procedure for 2-lane, 2-way roads with flagging operations. CRITICAL ORDER - follow steps in sequence.

items.label: PJSB completed - all crew members attended and documented
Equipment inspected - all items functional
Posted speed confirmed - determines spacing calculations
Escape route identified - both approaches, clear, level ground
Storm whistle signals agreed - 3 blasts = danger
Roles assigned - driver, passenger, flagger A, flagger B
Shadow vehicle ready - amber lights functional

sections.title: Phase 1: Install Advance Warning Signs - Approach A

items.label: Park at Sign A location (furthest upstream), amber lights ON
Both crew members don PPE, vests zipped
Passenger exits first - acts as qualified observer
Passenger positions 5-10 yards behind truck, facing traffic
Driver retrieves stand, setup on shoulder
Driver attaches Sign A (Road Work Ahead)
Both return to truck - passenger enters LAST
Drive to Sign B location per spacing calculation
Repeat process for Sign B (One Lane Road Ahead)
Repeat process for Sign C (Be Prepared to Stop)
Repeat process for Sign D (Flagger Symbol)
NOTE: ONLY one person outside vehicle at a time

sections.title: Phase 2: Install Advance Warning Signs - Approach B

items.label: Drive to Approach B (opposite direction)
Repeat sign installation - same sequence as Approach A
Verify all signs visible, upright, stable, retroreflective
NOTE: BILATERAL setup - both approaches must be complete

sections.title: Phase 3: Position Flaggers at Both Approaches

items.label: Verify qualified observer present - MANDATORY
Verify flaggers certified - STOP/SLOW trained
Test radios - functional comms for all crew
Test storm whistles - audible at distance
Confirm escape routes - both approaches walkable
Flagger A positions at Approach A taper start
Flagger B positions at Approach B termination
Establish alternating flow - radio coordination
NOTE: NEVER proceed without qualified observer
Position vehicle at downstream end of taper, amber lights ON
Qualified observer active - driver or dedicated
Place first cone at taper point (closest to work)
Work upstream - vehicle in reverse
Place cones at spacing: 10ft (25-35mph), 15ft (40-50mph), 20ft (55-70mph)
Continue to upstream end - taper complete
Verify smooth transition - alignment correct
NOTE: Refer to spacing calculator for taper length

sections.title: Phase 5: Install Buffer Space and Work Area Cones

items.label: Install buffer cones - distance: 250ft to 820ft per speed
Spacing 40ft - tangent section, both sides
Enclose work area perimeter as needed
Leave equipment access openings
Walk entire setup - visual inspection
Verify all signs visible, upright, stable
Verify all cones upright, proper spacing
Final radio check - all crew comms working
Confirm escape routes still clear - not blocked by equipment
NOTE: Refer to spacing calculator for buffer distances
